Computer Science Research

Luca Pinello Lab

Data Science Intern

June 2020 - Present

pinellolab.org

Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) Cancer Center, Harvard University.

Applied python (pandas) in Jupyter Notebooks, for STREAM analysis of hematopoietic scRNA-seq data. Prepared dataset uploaded to singlecellvr.com ’kowalczyk2015-stream”’ in GitHub. Developed notebook for RNA-velocity data preparation/configuration on singlecellvr.com (can be viewed here on the singlecellvr repository).

Article under review Stein, D., Chen, H., Vinyard, M., Qin, Q., Combs, R.D., Zhang, Q., Pinello, L. SinglecellVR: interactive visualization of single-cell data in virtual reality (Computational Genomics, Frontiers in Bioinformatics).

Nancy Kanwisher Lab

Summer Intern

May 2018 - August 2018

kanwisherlab.org

Picower Institute for Learning and Memory, Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT).

Applied HTML and python graphical user interfaces (GUIs) to develop digital oscillator. Web based app can be used for human memory color analysis.

↓ Oscillator Application Report

Biology Research

Biogen

Wet-lab biologist

June 2018

biogencommunitylab.com

Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Applied PCR to A.victoria jellyfish blue fluorescent protein (BFP) cDNA for site-directed mutagenesis (Y66H). Modification turned BFP to green fluorescent protein (GFP). Performed bacteria transformation, gel electrophoresis (agarose and PAGE), chemiluminescence, and spectrophotometry. Used for cell visualization.

Lab Director: Dr. Alazar Ayele

↓ Findings and Images
Click here for full-sized poster image.

BioBuilder Biology Research Epicenter

Wet-lab biologist

February 2020

biobuilder.org

Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Applied PCR to S.cerevisiae yeast DNA. Identified colonies with β-carotene producing gene (crtYB). Applied restriction digest and gel electrophoresis. Used to identify yeast culture that fortifies bread with Vitamin A.

Lab Director: Dr. Vivek Bajaj

↓ Presentation for Procedure/Findings

MIT Museum

Teen Programming Council Member

September 2017 - May 2019

mitmuseum.mit.edu

Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Organized symposia (Science Cafés) for Boston area teens. Played a key role in contacting local researchers to present their work. Delivered opening remarks at each event.

Leadership Positions

FIRST Robotics Competition Club Team #6731

Team Captain

September 2019 - May 2020


Appointed co-captain of Belmont MA’s robotics team, Record Robotics. From 2017-2021, worked with teammates and mentors to compete at the annual FIRST Robotics Competition, developed and managed our old web-page and organized outreach events at local elementary schools, the public library, and the MIT Museum. Pitched before Nobel Laureate Sir James Fraser Stoddart to solicit financial support for the coming robotics season, leading to a $10,000 donation.
